requests.name: api/admin/role/show/:id
requests.description:
this displays a specific role with the id passed as the paramater...if the
the header must also carry Authorization: Bearer <token>

responseCode.name: OK
responseCode.detail: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

headers.name: access-control-allow-credentials
headers.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

headers.name: access-control-allow-headers
headers.value: Origin, Content-Type, Accept, Authorization, X-Request-With, cache-control
headers.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

headers.name: access-control-allow-methods
headers.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

headers.name: access-control-allow-origin
headers.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

headers.name: cache-control
headers.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

headers.name: connection
headers.description: Options that are desired for the connection

headers.name: content-type
headers.description: The mime type of this content

headers.name: date
headers.description: The date and time that the message was sent

headers.name: host
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: x-powered-by
headers.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

headers.name: x-ratelimit-limit
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: x-ratelimit-remaining
headers.description: Custom header

requests.name: api/admin/logout
requests.description:
to logout an admin the token is required to be passed as a post parameter as well as the token is to be added on the header of the request with the parameter:
Authorization..example:
      'token' => $jwtoken on the body and on the header of the request..
      Authorization=>Bearer <token>

requests.name: api/admin/user/ban/:id
requests.description:
this is to ban a user  
required body content:
        'id'=>requried
the header must also carry Authorization: Bearer <token>
response=>{
on success..."success"=>true,
message=>'user banned successfully'
               
on failure...'success' => false,
            'message' => 'user ban was not successfully'
}

requests.description:
to display profile, token on the body is required and the authorization on the header with the bearer and the token

      Authorization=>Bearer <token>
response: admin details

requests.name: api/admin/role/all-content/:pagination?
requests.description:
this displays all the roles with or without pagination...if the
last parameter which is the pagination is not added it fetches all the roles without pagination and if it is added it paginates all contents dependent on the pagination details..
the header must also carry Authorization: Bearer <token>
